Core Principles - Throughput (Hosting) Locations 
 
1. Introduction 
This document details JIG recommended practice for implementing and maintaining the 
Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles for Operating Companies providing 
throughput for other suppliers' aviation fuel through their facilities (storage, hydrant and into-
plane fuelling services) around the world. 
1.1 The JV Core Principles were introduced in July 2008 to give JVs clear competition law 
guidance on controlling and containing the flow of sensitive information which is strictly 
necessary for the safe and efficient operation of a JV. Related confidentiality agreements 
were also put in place between the key parties to manage this process. The JIG 
members have now decided it would be prudent to extend the relevant obligations from 
these documents to Throughout (Hosting) Locations. Section 2 of this Bulletin describes 
the process that Throughput Operating Companies need to follow to adopt the 
Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles. 
1.2 The Operator of the Throughput (Hosting) Location is responsible for implementing and 
maintaining the Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles.

2. Standard Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles 
2.1 It is recommended that every Throughput (Hosting) Location involving aviation fuel 
storage, hydrant and/or into-plane fuelling services adopt the Throughput (Hosting) 
Location Core Principles Documents to demonstrate a controlled process for handling 
sensitive information within the Throughput (Hosting) Location. 
2.2 The Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles Documents (see Attachment 1) are 
standard form documents and it is recommended that they are implemented without 
revision to ensure consistency across the industry. Changes should not be made to 
Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles unless the changes have been approved 
by the Operator and all Throuputters legal representatives. 
2.3 The Throughput (Hosting) Location suite of documents is:

Confidentiality Agreement(s).

company)

3. The Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles Training 
3.1 Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager should receive initial Throughput (Hosting) Core 
Principles training from a competent person from the Operating Company familiar with 
the Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles. 
3.2 Each year the Operating Company should provide the Throughput (Hosting) Location 
Manager with standard Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles refresher training 
packs which the Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager will then use to train his/her 
employees as follows: 
3.2.1 Full training pack for Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager Key Staff (Throughput 
(Hosting) Location Manager and staff most involved in using sensitive information) 
3.2.2 Summarised training pack for operators and other Throughput (Hosting) Location 
staff 
3.3 The Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager should retain Throughput (Hosting) 
Location Core Principles training records for each employee. 
 
4. Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles Compliance Audits 
4.1 It is recommended that each Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager should complete 
an annual self-audit of the operation using the standard Throughput (Hosting) Location 
Core Principles Compliance

1 It is recommended that each Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager should complete 
an annual self-audit of the operation using the standard Throughput (Hosting) Location 
Core Principles Compliance Audit Form (available to download from the JIG Website in 
2011). It is recommended this is completed after carrying out the annual training in 
Throughput (Hosting) Location Core Principles. 
4.1.1 By October 2012, every airport Throughput (Hosting) Location should complete a 
self-audit and annually thereafter. The Throughput (Hosting) Location Compliance 
Audit Form which will be available on the JIG website early in 2011. 
4.1.2 Audit findings should be reported to the Operating Company at the earliest 
opportunity and no later than June 30th 2012. 
4.1.3 The Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager should ensure that any 2012 audit 
findings are resolved by October 31st 2012, or earlier if directed by the Operating 
Company. 
4.2 Completed Throughput (Hosting) Location Compliance Audits should be distributed by 
the Throughput (Hosting) Location Manager to the Operator and Throughputter 
Representatives. Completed audits at JIG sites (which will only be accessible to 
authorised Throughputters) should also be uploaded to the JIG Website via the Core 
Principles Audits option from the Members Area.

This document is intended for the guidance of Members of the Joint Inspection Group (JIG) and
